description: Remote sensing and GIS are increasingly used to address basic and applied questions in the environmental sciences and a host of other disciplines. Students survey available remote sensing image types and learn to process (ground-truthing, GPS, scanning, digitizing) and interpret remotely sensed images. They also learn theory and practice of geographic information systems (basic cartography and spatial statistics). A weekly three-hour laboratory is required. Prerequisites: Environmental Studies 137 or a level 1 course in biology, chemistry, or physics. Offered annually.
name: Remote Sensing & GIS
notes: Students in Env St 255 must also register for lab Env St 255 L.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Environmental Studies 137 or a level 1 course in biology, chemistry, or physics. Offered annually.
title: Remote Sensing and Geographic Information Systems
